question: Which two countries form the basin countries of the Gulf of Tadjoura?
explanation: Djibouti and Somalia form the basin countries of the Gulf of Tadjoura. Gulf of Tadjoura is located in the Indian Ocean basin of the Horn of Africa, south of the southern entrance to the Red Sea at the Bab-el-Mandeb straits. This gulf houses several marine habitats such as coral reefs, pearl oysters, seagrass beds, salt pans and mangroves.
